nodes.text: A flight computer was a type of computer used aboard starships, whose primary purpose was translation of the movement of the controls into adjustments to the direction of the ship's thrust. Flight computers could also store information, such as ship schematics and language information, or run programs off datachips, such as flight simulations. The company Torplex manufactured sophisticated flight computers which were used aboard the First Order TIE/fo and TIE/sfs, as well as an experimental one for Elrik Vonreg's TIE/ba Baron Space Superiority Interceptor.
